page.title: 06RECENT HISTORY BURTON LAZARS
page.content: Burton Lazars is a village of around 250 inhabitants situated about a mile and a half from the centre of Melton Mowbray. In local history the earliest references to the village are in the Domesday Book when the village was then called Burtone.The lazars was added several hundred years after the Domesday book when a Leper colony was established in the village. The earthworks of the Leper hospital can still be seen on farm land to the west of the village. During the last 100 years a racecourse was built on the south side of the village and very popular steeplechase events were held up to 1939.The races were attended by royalty such as Edward Prince of Wales and the Duke of Gloucester.Royalty used to stay overnight in the village.
